channel.title: Skill animations dont stop
channel.description:
server source and client: xenon link: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=662648.0
detailed problem: ive only tested it with mining and wcing because i was trying to work on coding each skill in a specific order but i figured if i learn how to fix the problem with those skills then i can fix it if it happens with any of my other skills i test in the future. * when you start mining and woodcutting it starts the animation just fine but when you try to walk away the animation continues; you can be running around mining/ woodcutting the air lol. its a funny looking and annoying glitch that i would really like to have fixed. * also when you are standing a distance from a tree or ore that you click on to mine/ wc, it starts the animations right away as your running towards the ore/ tree. What i want it to go if you click on a ore/ tree in the distance is you run up to the ore/ tree then start to mine/ wc it when you get right beside it like it is supposed to be.
I am not sure what is causing either of these glitches but i would really like to have both of them fixed. any help/ tips are acceptable and apprisiated but i played with thee codes in the skilling folders and did some googling on it and got no where at all, so if you really know the fix and could give me a little more descriptive help on this that would be great.
thanks ahead -mike

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @trilogy-reborn trilogy-reborn
item.description:
@trilogy-reborn wrote:

i dont really understand what to do with this program.
how do you compile it using the program?
will it tell me where to move brackets or just that its in wrong place?

do you have skype and willing to help me some more?

Read full topic

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

The error message only appears when you try to compile. I really recommend that you learn how to use it and how to use the debug tool, it will help you a lot if you struggling and don’t know why a bit of code isn’t running (Code in if statements, for loops, switches etc.).

unexpected token & unknown class “mining”

grr lol

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Bowser jr:

sk8rdude461: IntelliJ IDEA support both Java and Scala (with more). He can use either. If you’re using IDEA you’ll probably want to use : File -> New -> Project from exiting sources.

Yeah I just don’t know how the IDE works fully. I use eclipse and it’s layout is different (There’s a few more on screen buttons lol), and I’m sure some of it’s options are as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

sk8rdude461: IntelliJ IDEA support both Java and Scala (with more). He can use either. If you’re using IDEA you’ll probably want to use : File -> New -> Project from exiting sources.

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“trilogy-reborn, post:21, topic:551791”]i just never used an ide and wasnt too sure about how to use it or anything. i tried to code with eclipse before and it confused me so i normally just use notepad++ lol…
most experianced coders normally say thats stupid to use but its always been basic and easy to use for me lol.

i googled eclipse ide and got this: http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/packages/elipse-ide-java-ee-developers/junosr1 should i try to dl and use that?

edit: nvm i the eclipse on had 1,5hr dl time so i seen the dl link in you signature and the free verson only had 6min dl time so im dling that.
never used it before though so im curious if i will be able to figure it out or if i am going to be as confused as when i first tried to use eclipse with no experience with it

Edit 2:
mine doesnt show the errors like it does on your screen. i looked through tool for a debuger or compiler or that message make tool on your screen but i didnt see it. i never used this program so im not to sure how to use it or how it work.
its not soing me any errors or where its located or how to fix it lol[/quote]
He’s using Scala, I’m not 100% how it works as all IDEs are different (Mostly in controls… that’s about it).
However, I’m sure you need to either A) Create a new project and select your server source as the project folder. or B) Open the server source as a project.
Which one you do I’m not sure, I’d have to download his ide and take a look. Look in the File menu and when you add the source, make sure it’s the entire source and not just 1 file.

Read full topic

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

You really didn’t get what I said about finding the error yourself.
Your process method is broken. Your problem is at line 1636, as the error message told you. You have the correct amount of brackets, but you placed them at the wrong places.


The IDE helps you matching brackets, and will easily help you find the problem.

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @trilogy-reborn trilogy-reborn
item.description:
@trilogy-reborn wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Post the entire process method… There are bits missing and I cannot tell if they were missing because of you, because of a copy error, or what.

this what you need?

[code]/**Client all = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
if (killStreak == 2) {
getItems().addItem(995,500000);
}*/
if (getItems().updateInventory)
getItems().updateInventory();

		if (SpeDelay > 0) {
		startAnimation(3170);//if loading 602 (3170)
		dealDamage(10);
		handleHitMask(10);
		SpeDelay -= 1;
		getPA().refreshSkill(3);	
	}
	
	

	if(trade11 > 0) {
		trade11--;
	}
            if(vestaDelay > 0) {
               vestaDelay--;
            }
	if(gwdelay > 0) {
		gwdelay--;
	}
	if(summonSpec > 0) {
		summonSpec--;
	}
	if(clawDelay > 0) {
		clawDelay--;
	}
	if(clawDelay == 1) {
	    delayedDamage = clawDamage/4;
	    delayedDamage2 = (clawDamage/4)+1;
		if(clawType == 2) {
			getCombat().applyNpcMeleeDamage(clawIndex, 1, clawDamage/4);
		}
		if(clawType == 1) {
			getCombat().applyPlayerMeleeDamage(clawIndex, 1, clawDamage/4);
		}
		if(clawType == 2) {
			getCombat().applyNpcMeleeDamage(clawIndex, 2, (clawDamage/4) + 1);
		}
		if(clawType == 1) {
			getCombat().applyPlayerMeleeDamage(clawIndex, 2, (clawDamage/4) + 1);
		}
		clawDelay = 0;
		specEffect = 0;
		previousDamage = 0;
		usingClaws = false;
		clawType = 0;
	}

} else if (miningTimer > 0 && mining[0] > 0) {
		miningTimer--;
} else if (miningTimer == 0 && mining[0] > 0) {
		getMining().mineOre();
	if (smeltTimer > 0 && smeltType > 0) {
		smeltTimer--;
	if (smeltTimer == 0 && smeltType > 0) {
		getSmithing().smelt(smeltType);
		getSmithing().smelt(smeltType);
		}
	}
	if(System.currentTimeMillis() - saveGameDelay > Config.SAVE_TIMER && !disconnected) {
		saveCharacter = true; 
		saveGameDelay = System.currentTimeMillis();
	}

	
	if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastPoison > 20000 && poisonDamage > 0) {
		int damage = poisonDamage/2;
		if (damage > 0) {
			if (!getHitUpdateRequired()) {
				setHitUpdateRequired(true);
				setHitDiff(damage);
				updateRequired = true;
				poisonMask = 1;
			} else if (!getHitUpdateRequired2()) {
				setHitUpdateRequired2(true);
				setHitDiff2(damage);
				updateRequired = true;
				poisonMask = 2;
			}
			lastPoison = System.currentTimeMillis();
			poisonDamage--;
			dealDamage(damage);
		} else {
			poisonDamage = -1;
			sendMessage("You are no longer poisoned.");
		}	
	}

	
	
	if(System.currentTimeMillis() - duelDelay > 800 && duelCount > 0) {
		if(duelCount != 1) {
			forcedChat(""+(--duelCount));
			duelDelay = System.currentTimeMillis();
		} else {
			damageTaken = new int[Config.MAX_PLAYERS];
			forcedChat("FIGHT!");
			duelCount = 0;
		}
	}

	if(System.currentTimeMillis() - specDelay > Config.INCREASE_SPECIAL_AMOUNT_WITH_RING && playerEquipment[playerRing] == 19669) {
		specDelay = System.currentTimeMillis();
			if(specAmount < 10) {
				specAmount += .5;
			if (specAmount > 10)
				specAmount = 10;
			getItems().addSpecialBar(playerEquipment[playerWeapon]);
		}
	} else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - specDelay > Config.INCREASE_SPECIAL_AMOUNT) {
		specDelay = System.currentTimeMillis();
			if(specAmount < 10) {
				specAmount += .5;
			if (specAmount > 10)
				specAmount = 10;
			getItems().addSpecialBar(playerEquipment[playerWeapon]);
		}
	}
	
	if(clickObjectType > 0 && goodDistance(objectX + objectXOffset, objectY + objectYOffset, getX(), getY(), objectDistance)) {
		if(clickObjectType == 1) {
			getActions().firstClickObject(objectId, objectX, objectY);
		}
		if(clickObjectType == 2) {
			getActions().secondClickObject(objectId, objectX, objectY);
		}
		if(clickObjectType == 3) {
			getActions().thirdClickObject(objectId, objectX, objectY);
		}
	}
	
	if((clickNpcType > 0) && Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex] != null) {			
		if(goodDistance(getX(), getY(), Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].getX(), Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].getY(), 1)) {
			if(clickNpcType == 1) {
				turnPlayerTo(Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].getX(), Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].getY());
				Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].facePlayer(playerId);
				getActions().firstClickNpc(npcType);
			}
			if(clickNpcType == 2) {
				turnPlayerTo(Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].getX(), Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].getY());
				Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].facePlayer(playerId);
				getActions().secondClickNpc(npcType);
			}
			if(clickNpcType == 3) {
				turnPlayerTo(Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].getX(), Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].getY());
				Server.npcHandler.npcs[npcClickIndex].facePlayer(playerId);
				getActions().thirdClickNpc(npcType);
			}
		}
	}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

} else if (miningTimer > 0 && mining[0] > 0) { miningTimer--; } else if (miningTimer == 0 && mining[0] > 0) { getMining().mineOre(); if (smeltTimer > 0 && smeltType > 0) { smeltTimer--; if (smeltTimer == 0 && smeltType > 0) { getSmithing().smelt(smeltType); getSmithing().smelt(smeltType); }
Not counting the first green one which is the end of another statement... There is 4 opening brackets and 2 closing ones.

And in your edited one:

} else if (miningTimer > 0 && mining[0] > 0) { miningTimer--; } else if (miningTimer == 0 && mining[0] > 0) { getMining().mineOre(); if (smeltTimer > 0 && smeltType > 0) { smeltTimer--; if (smeltTimer == 0 && smeltType > 0) { getSmithing().smelt(smeltType); getSmithing().smelt(smeltType); } }
You're up to 3 closing (ignoring #1) and 4 opening.

Note: You probably one the closing bracket to be before the next if statement.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @trilogy-reborn trilogy-reborn

ha sk8er, 20mins really to completely rewrite the skill file?
it would be awesome is your could write a wc and mining system for me that works pretty well.

also nova says to go to snippets and find a wc and mining system and sk8er started hinting how to fix it so i guess i will go and try to fix it and if i have a lot of problems then i will go look in snippets.

edit: okay i tried to follow this guide to replace my whole wcing system:
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/snippets/373042-pi-woodcutting.html

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @novadude8347 novadude8347
item.description:
@novadude8347 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:551791”][quote author=novadude8347 link=topic=670705.msg4484864#msg4484864 date=1433347272]
Your woodcutting and mining bases are almost empty, could take hours of development or you need to go to snippets and find a pi mining/woodcutting base, since yours has nothing, and i’m sure it has a bunch of bugs.
[/quote]
Hours? You’re joking…
I could write a new mining system in 20 minutes. Easily. Same for woodcutting. They’re basically the exact same, except you replace a couple IDs.
Also, his source is a 317 PI loading 525 content, he does not have a 525 source.[/quote]

20 minutes for you, hours for me, days for him. See what I did there?

Read full topic

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

novadude8347:

Your woodcutting and mining bases are almost empty, could take hours of development or you need to go to snippets and find a pi mining/woodcutting base, since yours has nothing, and i’m sure it has a bunch of bugs.

Hours? You’re joking…
I could write a new mining system in 20 minutes. Easily. Same for woodcutting. They’re basically the exact same, except you replace a couple IDs.
Also, his source is a 317 PI loading 525 content, he does not have a 525 source.
[hr]

OP:
In Walking.java, reset the woodcutting and mining variables.
Specifically: wcTimer (for the client object), and miningTimer (again, for the client object)
and then reset the animation to default (65535).

Read full topic

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @novadude8347 novadude8347
item.description:
@novadude8347 wrote:

Your woodcutting and mining bases are almost empty, could take hours of development or you need to go to snippets and find a pi mining/woodcutting base, since yours has nothing, and i’m sure it has a bunch of bugs.

Read full topic

item.title: Skill animations dont stop
item.dc:creator: @trilogy-reborn trilogy-reborn
item.description:
@trilogy-reborn wrote:

okay so do the 700+ coding still work if i use it for 525 and pi? i kinda assume it does cause it is still java code lol.

but i think i can copy paste your code to my mining and wcing files but then paste them a second time and edit the second code so that it stops the animation when i click to walk away.

but i have to figure out where in my file the codes should go and i have to figure out how to write the java code to say do what i want.

anyways here is my mining.java:

[code]package server.model.players.skills;

import server.model.players.*;
import server.Config;
import server.util.Misc;
import java.sql.Date;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
import java.util.Calendar;

/**

  • @Author Sanity
    */

public class Mining {

Client c;

private final int VALID_PICK[] = {1265,1267,1269,1273,1271,1275};
private final int[] PICK_REQS = {1,1,6,6,21,31,41,61};
private final int[] RANDOM_GEMS = {1623,1621,1619,1617,1631};
private int oreType;
private int exp;
private int levelReq;
private int pickType;
private final int EMOTE = 624;

public Mining(Client c) {
	this.c = c;
}

public void startMining(int oreType, int levelReq, int exp) {
	c.turnPlayerTo(c.objectX, c.objectY);
	if (goodPick() > 0) {
		if (c.playerLevel[c.playerMining] >= levelReq) {
			this.oreType = oreType;
			this.exp = exp;
			this.levelReq = levelReq;
			this.pickType = goodPick();
			c.sendMessage("You swing your pick at the rock.");
			c.miningTimer = getMiningTimer(oreType);
			c.startAnimation(EMOTE);
		} else {
			resetMining();
			c.sendMessage("You need a mining level of " + levelReq + " to mine this rock.");
			c.startAnimation(65535);
		}		
	} else {
		resetMining();
		c.sendMessage("You need a pickaxe to mine this rock.");
		c.startAnimation(65535);
		c.getPA().resetVariables();
	}
}

public void mineOre() {
	if (c.getItems().addItem(oreType,1)) {
		c.startAnimation(EMOTE);
		c.sendMessage("You manage to mine some ore.");
		c.getPA().addSkillXP(exp * Config.MINING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerMining);[/code]

here is my wcing.java:

[code]package server.model.players.skills;

import server.model.players.*;
import server.Config;
import server.util.Misc;
import java.sql.Date;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
import java.util.Calendar;

/**

  • @Author Sanity
    */

public class Woodcutting {

Client c;

private final int VALID_AXE[] = {1351,1349,1353,1361,1355,1357,1359,6739};
private final int[] AXE_REQS = {1,1,6,6,21,31,41,61};
private int logType;
private int exp;
private int levelReq;
private int axeType;
private final int EMOTE = 875;

public Woodcutting(Client c) {
	this.c = c;
}

public void startWoodcutting(int logType, int levelReq, int exp) {
	if (goodAxe() > 0) {
		c.turnPlayerTo(c.objectX, c.objectY);
		if (c.playerLevel[c.playerWoodcutting] >= levelReq) {
			this.logType = logType;
			this.exp = exp;
			this.levelReq = levelReq;
			this.axeType = goodAxe();
			c.wcTimer = getWcTimer();
			c.startAnimation(EMOTE);
		} else {
			c.getPA().resetVariables();
			c.startAnimation(65535);
			c.sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of " + levelReq + " to cut this tree.");
		}		
	} else {
		c.startAnimation(65535);
		c.sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree.");
		c.getPA().resetVariables();
	}
}

public void resetWoodcut() {
	this.logType = -1;
	this.exp = -1;
	this.levelReq = -1;
	this.axeType = -1;
	c.wcTimer = -1;	
}

public void cutWood() {
	if (c.getItems().addItem(logType,1)) {
		c.startAnimation(EMOTE);
		c.sendMessage("You get some logs.");
		c.getPA().addSkillXP(exp * Config.WOODCUTTING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerWoodcutting);
		c.getPA().refreshSkill(c.playerWoodcutting);
		c.wcTimer = getWcTimer();
	} else {
		c.getPA().resetVariables();
	}
}

public int goodAxe() {
	for (int j = VALID_AXE.length - 1; j >= 0; j--) {
		if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == VALID_AXE[j]) {
			if (c.playerLevel[c.playerWoodcutting] >= AXE_REQS[j])
				return VALID_AXE[j];
		}		
	}
	for (int i = 0; i < c.playerItems.length; i++) {
		for (int j = VALID_AXE.length - 1; j >= 0; j--) {
			if (c.playerItems[i] == VALID_AXE[j] + 1) {
				if (c.playerLevel[c.playerWoodcutting] >= AXE_REQS[j])
					return VALID_AXE[j];
			}
		}		
	}
	return - 1;
}

public int getWcTimer() {
	int time = Misc.random(5);
	return time;
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
